From: Cisco IOS Configuration Fundamentals Command Reference
FuncDef: To assign a logical name to a connection, use the **name-connection** command in user EXEC mode.

ParaDef.Info: This commmand has no arguments or keywords.

Examples: The following example assigns the logical name blueto the connection:
Conn Host Address Byte Idle Conn Name
Connection 1 to doc-2509 will be named "BLUE" [ confirm ]
ExtraInfo: This command can be useful for keeping track of multiple connections.You are prompted for the connection number and name to assign. The **where** command displays a list of the assigned logical connection names.

RelatedCmds.description: Lists open sessions associated with the current terminal line.
